abbreviation for versus
Add to word list
Add to word list
used when making a comparison between two things, ideas, or opinions: The S&P hotel index has gained 40%, vs. a 13% rise for the S&P 500.
used to show that two people, groups, organizations, etc. oppose each other in a competition, legal disagreement, etc.: The case is Gentry vs. Superior Court.
